The first hints of this unusual arrangement emerged in the 1980s, when a study published in the _Canadian Journal of Military Studies_ noted a significant increase in chaplaincy involvement in senior non-commissioned officer training programs (1). In 2005, a series of internal Canadian Armed Forces documents were leaked to the press, revealing a previously unknown protocol governing the appointment of senior non-commissioned officers (2).
